intro: Anisochilus albidus, commonly known as the white-stemmed fern, is a rare and delicate plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright fronds that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically located on the underside of its leaves. Anisochilus albidus thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires consistent moisture and high air humidity to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural habitat.
